website_summaries.verdict: Best all-around guitar on this shortlist, but it is pricey.
pros: A top-notch beginner's guitar modeled after the popular FG series
Sounds and feels like a professional guitar, down to its rich, clear tone
Doesn't have  the "tinny" sound of many beginner guitars
cons: Slightly smaller than the average 3/4-size, at 35.5" x 16.2" x 4.8"

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful but this is 1/2 size, NOT 3/4.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not complaining about the quality of this guitar but the item description. This is NOT a 3/4 size, it's actually 1/2. Checked measurement too, it's 33 in. I asked for replacement and still got exactly the same thing, didn't even bother to open the box. They need to check the product description and sizes. I had to return the second one too since it was too small for my kid.
customer_reviews.author: lamama

customer_reviews.title: Not just for beginners-this is great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I've been playing for thirty years and I think this is a great little guitar. I agree with the other reviewer who mentioned that this does not seem like a 3/4th size guitar, seems maybe smaller, but, I like the size. The action is great out of the box. I agree with the reviewer who mentioned that this guitar projects and resonates lower tones a lot better than you would think it would due to its size. A fun, portable, easy to play guitar with some nice tones that has now taken up permanent residence next to my tv room chair. Great job by Yamaha (as usual)!
customer_reviews.author: Craig Stoughton

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic quality and sound
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic guitar. Great sound. Got it for my six-year-old. It’s a bit big for him but he’s still comfortable using it and it will be able to grow with him. I’ve also played it and been very comfortable so it would be a great travel guitar for an adult. Came recommended by his guitar teacher and he was right on. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to be a good pick. I was really surprised when it arrived ...
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old has a toy guitar that is always hooked to his side. I knew if he was really interested in playing I should get him somthing he could really play. After reading the reviews, this Yamaha FG jr. Seemed to be a good pick. I was really surprised when it arrived of the overall quality of the instrument. Going from a kids department store acoustic guitar to the Yamaha is like going from a toy guitar to an instrument you could use in at music lessons, recital, campfire ect. The guitar is clear, crisp, and loud. This is the real deal.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Pickey

customer_reviews.title: Good little guitar for the price
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife, she's tiny @ 5'2, small hands. She has no problem handling this guitar. Holds a tune, sounds good, good price.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginners
customer_reviews.text: If you want to learn to play guitar, start with a good one like this. It is a bit smaller than a standard guitar, so you don't have to spread your fingers as far to finger the chords. The play is easy. You don't have to press down real hard to finger chords. The sound is nice. It keeps tune if you tighten it up a bit. The craftmanship is acceptable. I had to adjust it because the low E was rattling. But, if you are just learning, a little rattle isn't a bad thing. You'll eventually learn some good chords and upgrade to a better guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha FG JR1 3/4 Size Acoustic Guitar
customer_reviews.text: I bought this guitar for my 5 year old Grandson's 6th birthday because he expressed a serious interest in learning to play. It came, on time and well packed. I have a Gibson J-50 and the fit & finish of this Yamaha is somewhat comparable. It did not need neck adjustment and was a snap to tune. Frankly, for the price and craftsmanship, it can not be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice little guitar for youth
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice little guitar for youth. I would get different strings because the strings are a bit harsh but that's an easy fix . It's a great little guitar. I highly recommend. The sound is very nice for the price and it's a cute little guitar. It will also be good enough to take traveling to sit around the fire side if you need something small.
customer_reviews.author: Tami Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: nice guitar
customer_reviews.text: I just recieved my guitar, it is really nice, I bought the 3/4 size because I am 4' 11" and have small hands, so this guitar fits me well, the only thing that I was disappointed with was the lenght of the guitar, 33 inches is very small when you get it.. I almost returned it because I was at first taken back by its size ( will people laugh at me when I bring it in for lessons?) but it is a beautiful guitar with a nice sound to it.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Butler

customer_reviews.title: 3/4 or 1/2, you decide
customer_reviews.text: JR1 JR2 are 21.25" scale length. Mitchell DJ120 also 21.25. Martin SX1 is 23". Yamaha's own self proclaimed 1/2 size CJS120A has a scale length of 21". Yet JR series 21.25".... Anything over 21" may be considered 3/4 is all I can guess based on Yamaha's CJS102A and JR size nomenclature designations. Full size is 24-25.5" BTW.
customer_reviews.author: damian

customer_reviews.title: Great for very young / young beginners
customer_reviews.text: My 14 year old daughter, who is small for her size, has no problems playing this guitar. I stretched the stock strings and after that it stays in tune very well for at least a couple of days of practicing before she needs to make slight tuning adjustments. Yes it is small. My daughter thought I had messed up and purchased a Ukulele when she first saw the box, but now she practices daily on it and loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Vega

customer_reviews.title: A nice 3/4 guitar we purchased for our nine year old ...
customer_reviews.text: A nice 3/4 guitar we purchased for our nine year old daughter. It's a quality piece with great sound for a 3/4 size. It came with good strings, tuned up well, and holds its tune as expected. Our package only included the guitar and bag, which was some letdown. And, while the bag is nice, we have been having problems with the zipper. When it arrived the zipper was off track, and we have to unzip and zip again a few times to get a clean closure. Overall a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Marc L. Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Great 3/4 scale for children.
customer_reviews.text: I was very surprised when this arrived. It was a purchase for my 7 year old Godson and the quality and tone were a very pleasant surprise. The guitar arrived in great condition, the action was set well, neck was straight and the playability was great. The case is also quality. No complaints at all and he loves it because it looks similar to my Gibson J45 and now we are "guitar twins."
customer_reviews.author: Mike R.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't look like the picture. Maybe a knock off?
customer_reviews.text: This doesn't look like the picture. It's got a different finish and no tortoise shell tear drop on the body. I couldn't find a picture of any JR1 that looks like this. I'd say that it shouldn't matter, but I'd that was the case all guitars would look the same. Also it makes question whether or not this is a knock off
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner!
customer_reviews.text: My 7 year old son LOVES this guitar. Some have said it's a little pricey for a beginners but I am all about buying something quality that will last. He loves playing on this guitar and is always so excited to show it to everyone. It is easy for him to tune.
customer_reviews.author: champt02

customer_reviews.title: Great little guitar!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a small guitar to take along when I travel as I don't want to lug around my full sized guitar. This 3/4 sized guitar is just what I was looking for.It's a great little guitar and has nice action. When you take into consideration the very modest price, this is a fantastic value.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Shelton

customer_reviews.title: Hard to beat for the price...
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent little guitar. It is well made and sounds pretty good for it's size. The tuners work well; they're snug and turn smoothly. The result is that the guitar says decently in tune from one day to the next. This is a weak spot in many 3/4 scale entry level guitars. Frets all seem level, neck is straight, and there is no noticable fret buzz. Action is pretty good right out of the box on mine.
customer_reviews.author: mazzas

customer_reviews.title: The perfect starter guitar
customer_reviews.text: This is a great instrument for the price. If you're serious about your kid starting guitar, this is the way to go. Much better than the competition from Fender and other companies. This thing has great tone, comparable to my Ovation and other mid grade guitars.
customer_reviews.author: jmo308

customer_reviews.title: Good guitar for beginning children
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is right sized for a child to start lessons. And the instrument is well constructed and has good sound. I highly recommend. Yamaha has been making guitars for decades and their quality seems better than average.
customer_reviews.author: M. Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: A decent beginner's guitar
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our grandson and it is a decent 3/4 size acoustic guitar for a young beginner. He is just 4 but can hold it and strum it with ease. I like the fact that it holds its tune pretty well and doesn't sound tinny or cheap like some smaller guitars. I think he will like it and be able to learn some basic chords and strums on it. I have given guitar lessons to children for years and would recommend this as a good beginner instrument. Lauren
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: A real guitar for smaller hands
customer_reviews.text: Good sound, good action, definitely not a toy with nylon strings that most kids get. The gig bag could really use an exterior zipper pocket for picks, strings, notebook, etc. Tuning this for my son made me realize the tuners on my Yamaha are shot. Now if I can only convince the kids to practice...
customer_reviews.author: J Fernsten

customer_reviews.title: Good little guitar.
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice little guitar. I've been a professional guitarist for 53 years, and I bought this for my nine year old twins who wanted to learn. It's small enough for their hands, yet it plays like a real guitar. Tone is good for such a small body, and the intonation is right on. I did file the nut slots a little to make it easier to play, but I have to do that to my $5000 guitars too.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Zoom

customer_reviews.title: perfect for my 5 y/o
customer_reviews.text: nice tone, weight, and perfect size for a first guitar for a child or a travel guitar; comes with a soft case, no strap.
customer_reviews.author: hawthorn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 6yo beginner
customer_reviews.text: My son is 6 and recently started guitar lessons. He was rocking a cheap $40 guitar for the first 2 months but it was time to upgrade. This was a great fit for his age/size. Very nice guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Rhiannon

customer_reviews.title: A muffled, tinny, disappointment.
customer_reviews.text: I thought it sounded as if muffled and tinny replaced bass and treble. It gets good reviews, and it plays nicely (i.e. nice low action, nice feel to the fretboard). One chord at a time was fine, but when I really started playing, It just sounded muffled. It has real potential. M.ight be good for a child. But I needed it as a parlor guitar. Maybe the solid top option or new strings would have done the trick. So, I'm returning it and replacing it with a Seagull parlor model.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Albert

customer_reviews.title: This is perfect for my son who is seven and just learning ...
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for my son who is seven and just learning how to play. He is doing really well, it holds a tune, and its pretty sturdy. Definitely worth the cost, and time :) We are very happy with this purchase. I can see this lasting a looooong time!
customer_reviews.author: memine32

customer_reviews.title: Very portable because of it's size
customer_reviews.text: Good to practice on when you travel. Not very good sound. Don't use it for a Gig. The small Martin is better but costs a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: Carrol D.

customer_reviews.title: As good as the larger ones!
customer_reviews.text: Much better fit for me (a 5'5" woman) than the regular size. My teacher says this is a great little guitar. It stays tuned well, too. I'm totally happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: M Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a 3/4 size guitar like it says
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a 3/4 size guitar like it says. It is a 1/2 size guitar. For those that want a 1/2 size guitar it is a really nice guitar but too small for my daughter.
customer_reviews.author: Mandi Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Great value and quality
customer_reviews.text: Great learner guitar and great size for my 11yo. The guitar came with decent strings, stays in tune and sounds great like a full-sized. The tuner works well, fancy digital one. I hadn't ever owned one before (still use old school pitchpipes) but since it came free it's decadent. Dvd is good too with some songs to get started and chord library. Great value. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Danno

customer_reviews.title: Too small
customer_reviews.text: Too small I want a bigger one for a man Let me return or offer an exchange
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice guitar but it is 1/2 scale
customer_reviews.text: Well made quality guitar. Would be five stars but it is not a 3/4 scale. It is a 1/2 scale. But it works well for my son's small hands
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Great size.and sound.
customer_reviews.text: I love my quitar! Great size.Beautiful finish and nice sound.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia J Beekman

customer_reviews.title: Great for my 11 year old granddaughter
customer_reviews.text: She is really enjoying it and working hard at her lessons.
customer_reviews.author: Kime

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent small guitar
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent small guitar. Plays good. Sounds good. Great value. I bought this to play at the beach. It's much more than I expected for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Don Kitaoka

customer_reviews.title: Lessons next
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old is jamming to KISS. Go figure
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for young player
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter's guitar teacher recommended this starter guitar as she progressed through her lessons. It's beautiful, well made and sounds great. She's 7 and about 50" tall. It's a tad big but she'll grow into it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Guss

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift
customer_reviews.text: This guitar made my 8 year olds birthday. She loves it and the quality is outstanding. The cost was great and the guitar is perfect for her to learn on because of the size and sound. It is easy for her to play. The case is thin so if you're transporting the instrument, you'll need a padded case but this one works to keep it safe in the house.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Yamaha Jr a Great Buy!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for beginners! It sounds really good too. It's a very good guitar for practice because it is portable so I just grab it whenever I feel like playing it and it does not hurt your pocket. The price and the free Amazon shipping makes a perfect purchase. I would have gone with a guitalele but I'm glad I bought the Yamaha Jr because the guitalele's chords are not same on the regular acoustic guitar so I don't want to confuse myself even further. I'd say this purchase is a perfect one for me. I will buy the Yamaha FG730s for serious and quality sound jamming!
customer_reviews.author: andy808

customer_reviews.title: I didn't like it at all
customer_reviews.text: Does not hold a tune and sounds awful. As much as it pains me to say it, because I am a big Yamaha fan, I didn't like it at all. Only marginally better than a toy guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Locavore

customer_reviews.title: Good quality guitar
customer_reviews.text: Nice quality guitar for the price. Perfect for our 7 year old grandson
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Even though this is sized for a child, it isn't a toy-- it holds its tuning week to week in between lessons so little guy can play it whenever without having to take that step.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful gift for our grandson!
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is the right size for our young grandson. It has excellent tone and quality.
customer_reviews.author: Diane D

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 8 year old daughter. She just started lessons and it fits her perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Meh works for a kid.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew as a starter guitar. Its not a bad little jammer but it ain’t good either. Haha.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Stimpsom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect first guitar
customer_reviews.text: My 10 year old son has been taking lessons on this guitar for about 4 months. His teacher is very impressed with the sound and that it holds it's tune pretty well. It's been a great started guitar and now my 8 year old is wanting to start lessons and I'm going to buy a second one. My son had no trouble playing on the steel strings, but my 8 year old complains about the strings, I will likely have the 2nd guitar restrung with lighter strings.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Rae Buzzell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel size, holds tune.
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas present for my musician boyfriend and he absolutely loves it. He played it all weekend long and was impressed that it stayed in tune so well for being a smaller guitar. Perfect travel size, and we're giving it to my son next year for his first guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee Stoeppler

customer_reviews.title: Nice tuners--they don't feel cheap
customer_reviews.text: Lovely little guitar. I can play it in the passenger seat without poking the driver. Surprisingly big sound for a small body, and a very even tone. Seems very well-made. Nice tuners--they don't feel cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Michael David Martin

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality for entry level and stays in tune impressively well for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Guitar for my daughter who is 9 and just starting out. The size is perfect for her hands. We have used it for over a month and her Guitar Teacher has been impressed with how in-tune it stays. According to him most new guitars take a while for the Strings to settle in and he has been impressed with its quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great first guitar
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 10 yr old first guitar. We are been super happy with it. The quality is good and it came in secure packaging.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wigington

customer_reviews.title: Absolute best guitar of this price range
customer_reviews.text: This guitar is amazingly well made. It holds its tune perfectly. It has a rich, warm tone that is beyond what one would expect from a guitar its size. I have had various discount garbage guitars both electric and acoustic plus nice electric and acoustic guitars from Fender, Gibson, and Martin as well as a Cordoba ukulele. I love this thing and it makes me want to pick it up and play it. The bonus gig bag it comes with is also of good quality.
customer_reviews.author: joe

customer_reviews.title: Super for our 6 year old
customer_reviews.text: This guitar was a birthday present for my daughter who desperately wants to learn how to play the guitar and write her own songs. She has just begun taking lessons, and once the guitar was tuned, it sounds so beautiful. It is very nice quality, and we are super happy we made the purchase to get her started.
customer_reviews.author: C. Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: This instrument has turned out to be the perfect guitar for my 8-year-old grandson to begin playing
customer_reviews.text: This instrument has turned out to be the perfect guitar for my 8-year-old grandson to begin playing. Pretty sound, easy for him to play with his smaller hands. Good value for the $$, I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Lawson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 9 year old
customer_reviews.text: My 9 year old daughter is taking her first guitar lessons and this is the perfect size for her....she's doing so well.
customer_reviews.author: Riddle

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great little guitar for my beginner son. Stays in tune way better than I expected.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Hollenbach

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive guitar for beginners on up
customer_reviews.text: For the money this is one of the best beginner guitars you'll find. I bought this for my 10 year old son who expressed interest in learning guitar. It's sturdy and can handle some bumps and bangs. It sounds decent and feels pretty good. I bought a similar Yamaha as a teen 25 years ago and they still make a great product. I have no complaints about quality. I especially like how the size is reduced enough for a kid, but still very playable for an adult. I've enjoyed getting back into it as much as he is learning fresh. If you're new to guitars you won't be disappointed. If you're an experienced musician, you probably aren't reading this review...
customer_reviews.author: Mindphreak

customer_reviews.title: Great for small sized beginner.
customer_reviews.text: Great size for a 11 year old beginner. A full sized guitar would be too frustrating for his size. Appears to be a great starter guitar for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Perfect guitar for my 12yo daughter who has had difficulty reaching around the neck! And the sound quality-great!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jaighna

customer_reviews.title: ... guitars and did tons or research to chose the best beginner guitar for my 7 year old son and ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried dozens of guitars and did tons or research to chose the best beginner guitar for my 7 year old son and this was the winner. I am very happy with it and so is he!
customer_reviews.author: BigWaterPapa

customer_reviews.title: Great little travel guitar
customer_reviews.text: A great little quality guitar. It has a good feel, excellent tone and very playable.
customer_reviews.author: Micah778

customer_reviews.title: Good sound guitar
customer_reviews.text: Great sound for size. Boy, age 7, is very happy. Keeps tune well.
customer_reviews.author: Katja Battarbee

customer_reviews.title: Great for beginner
customer_reviews.text: I think this guitar is perfect for young adult as the first guitar. Great sound for a small guitar
customer_reviews.author: onlineuserK

customer_reviews.title: Small but sounds great
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 11 year old granddaughter and it's too small. This is nowhere near 3/4 size. However, this guitar sounds amazing! I ask her if I should send it back and she said no, it sounds beautiful and is fun to pick around on. Be aware that this is a SMALL guitar. The quality is there and it sounds awesome though.
customer_reviews.author: L.Harris

customer_reviews.title: Not a 3/4 size! It’s 1/2 size
customer_reviews.text: Good sounding guitar, but pretty pissed that I purchased what I was told was a 3/4 size, and was shipped a 1/2 size. CHANGE YOUR ITEM DESCRIPTION!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much what I expected for the price. The kids can use it for practice.
customer_reviews.author: George Brown

customer_reviews.title: 6-year olds first guitar
customer_reviews.text: Our son started guitar lessons a few months ago and this has been the perfect size and type of guitar for him to start with. It's well made and has a nice sound, we haven't had any problems with it. The protective case that comes with it is very practical, we use it all the time. The only complaint I have is that the zipper on the case gets stuck on the inside fabric so I had to trim it.
customer_reviews.author: Lana Bazan

customer_reviews.title: Nice starter
customer_reviews.text: Can't go wrong with this as a beginner guitar. As others have said, strings do stand high off fret board but that is easy to fix - or, leave as is to encourage proper technique and develop that vital finger strength plus dexterity.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Dixie

customer_reviews.title: and she loved it. It's easy to tune
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my sister, and she loved it. It's easy to tune, and sound great!
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Fyodorov

customer_reviews.title: Pleased
customer_reviews.text: Nice guitar 3/4 for the price. Not the sound of the Martin or Taylor, but a very well built guitar for a child to learn. Not really a bad travel guitar for an adult. I would recommend it to someone not trying to spend 300 on a 3/4. Stays in tune. Good and sturdy built guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Trey Alexander

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Got it fast, didn’t cost much, absolutely love it. Beautiful finish, great sound for a 3/4, did I say how much I love it?
customer_reviews.author: terry monroe

customer_reviews.title: It's the perfect guitar for travel and for smaller people learning the ...
customer_reviews.text: I play the guitar and then bought one for my granddaughter. It's the perfect guitar for travel and for smaller people learning the guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this purchase for my 8 year old daughter. Perfect size, decent sound. Great starter guitar!
customer_reviews.author: PortlandKCBrown

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and in great condition. Nice looking, great starter for younger kids.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Hollemans

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Solid guitar for a beginner, but note that it has steel strings that are tough on young fingers.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Holtz

customer_reviews.title: I ordered a 3/4 size for my daughter but the ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 3/4 size for my daughter but the one that came was a 1/2 size. It was also very orange in color. I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quitar
customer_reviews.text: Good starting guitar for my7yr old grandson,easy reach cords ,very good fit he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: great for 8yrs
customer_reviews.text: my kids love it. great for 8yrs. but still too big for my little one 4yrs. need a half size.
customer_reviews.author: george

customer_reviews.title: Great Guitar
customer_reviews.text: This is the best travel guitar! Really, really nice sound. I love it. I have a Martin and prefer this Yamaha. That says it all I think.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen P.

customer_reviews.title: Good! For Adults and travel. Jr1
customer_reviews.text: My earlier review was for the Jr2- I don't know why it was posted for the Jr1! Well, anyway this is a nice guitar for the money. There is some initial buzzing in the beginning- but not anymore. It has great tone- it's clear and bright. I like that. Great sustain. Great travel guitar for adults. comes w/ a gig bag. Jr1 is a great guitar- buy one NOW!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent starter guitar for my little boy. It's perfect for him! It arrived in excellent condition because it was efficiently and effectively packaged to protect it. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Cassie Price

customer_reviews.title: good guitar for student
customer_reviews.text: So far we love this little guitar. My 8 year old can hold it easily and it stays in tune so far. It looks nice, too. I even like to play it and like it better than our full size guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: good instrument
customer_reviews.text: Just needed to be tuned, but other than that it has stood the test of time. My daughter truly enjoys using this item and I think I would order same brand name again if needed for the future.
customer_reviews.author: Mighty Counselor

customer_reviews.title: Kids Guitar
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice little Guitar. Easy for small hands to learn on. I was pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: D. Adam Williams

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice sound for a small guitar. Fun and easy to play. Great price
customer_reviews.author: Marc C Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great guitar
customer_reviews.text: My son is taking lessons. The teacher recommended this guitar. I'm very happy with it and it sounds great.
customer_reviews.author: Brent_in_MO

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great guitar, my 6 years old loves it. And fits well
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: Nice little guitar!
customer_reviews.text: This little guitar sounds and plays great! I got this for my Granddaughter who is 8 and she and I love it. The intonation is just perfect, it tunes up easily and sounds great. Highly recommended. I may buy one for myself for campouts and road-trips, because it is so small it travels well. Great price for a really nice small guitar.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought for 9 yr old grandson, top quality for the price...

customer_reviews.title: Great Learner Guitar for Child
customer_reviews.text: Bought for an 8 year old girl after her first guitar fell apart; still going strong, holds tuning well. It's the perfect size for her, and it has the attachments to add a strap (not sure if that's standard or not).

product_meta.title: Yamaha FG JR1 3/4 Size Acoustic Guitar with Gig Bag - (Natural)
product_meta.description: Style:Standard| Size:Guitar| Color:Natural| Configuration:Guitar OnlyBuilt with the legendary quality and playability the FG Series, Yamaha designed the JR1 for the younger player or anyone who is more comfortable with a smaller-bodied acoustic. Carefully selection of woods goes into the building of every single Yamaha guitar and the JR1 is no exception. Features include a spruce top, nato neck, rosewood fingerboard and meranti body for solid, bright tonality and great looks, and chrome hardware. Includes gig bag. JR1 Great as a travel guitar First Guitar Ideal first guitar for a child easy and fun to play.
feature_bullets: Built with the legendary quality and playability
3/4 size for easy travel and comfortable playing
Ideal first guitar for a child
